questions.clue: This ancient empire, known for its capital city of Carthage, was famously defeated by Rome in the Punic Wars.
Ruled by King Piye, this ancient African empire once conquered Egypt and was known for its pyramids in Meroë.
This South American civilization, known for its capital Tiwanaku, once dominated the Andean region before the Incas.
This Southeast Asian empire, with its capital at Angkor, is known for constructing the temple complex Angkor Wat.
Centered in present-day Turkey, this ancient empire known for its advanced iron working was a rival to the Egyptians and Assyrians.

categories.name: Cosmic Wonders: Mysteries of the Universe

questions.clue: This celestial object is the center of our solar system and provides the energy necessary for life on Earth.
Known for its spectacular rings, this gas giant is the second largest planet in our solar system.
This term describes a region in space where the gravitational pull is so strong that nothing, not even light, can escape.
This phenomenon occurs when a massive star explodes in a brilliant burst of light after exhausting its nuclear fuel.
This theoretical boundary around a black hole marks the point beyond which nothing can escape its gravitational pull.

categories.name: Cinematic Landmarks: Milestones in Film History

questions.clue: This 1927 Al Jolson film was the first feature-length movie with synchronized dialogue sequences.
In 1939, this Technicolor film was the first to win the Best Picture Oscar.
Released in 1975, this film was the first major summer blockbuster, directed by Steven Spielberg.
This 1995 film was the first entirely computer-animated feature, produced by Pixar.
This 1999 film by The Wachowskis was among the first to popularize the bullet-time visual effect.

categories.name: Ecological Oddities: Unique Flora and Fauna

questions.clue: This giant panda's diet is 99% bamboo, yet it's classified as a carnivore.
Known for its corpse-like smell, this flower is the largest unbranched inflorescence in the world.
This small marsupial, native to Tasmania, is known for its ferocious temperament and powerful bite.
Able to regenerate lost body parts and reproduce asexually, this 'immortal' creature belongs to the Hydrozoa class.
This plant, known for its ability to trap and digest small animals, uses modified leaves to form a pitcher-like structure.
This sequence starts with 0 and 1, and each subsequent number is the sum of the previous two.
Named after a German mathematician, this triangle displays binomial coefficients.
This paradox involves a statement that refers to itself and questions its own truth.
This paradox illustrates a situation where adding a smaller object increases the total volume, famously involving a sphere.
Discovered by Kurt Gödel, this theorem states that in any consistent mathematical system, there are statements that are true but unprovable.

final.clue: This 1925 novel, often referred to as 'The Great American Novel', features a mysterious millionaire who is known for throwing lavish parties.
